intro: Dyakia hendersoniana, commonly known as the Henderson's dyakia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The species is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within lowland forests. Due to habitat loss, Dyakia hendersoniana is considered a rare and endangered species.
